constructs.name: error_resolution_duration
constructs.description: Time in minutes from first error-related search to apparent resolution (last related search before topic change or extended break)

constructs.name: search_iterations
constructs.description: Number of search queries performed during a debugging session before resolution, indicating search efficiency

constructs.name: technical_search_count
constructs.description: Daily count of searches and visits related to technical programming topics, indicating engagement with technology

constructs.name: debugging_start_hour
constructs.description: Hour of day (0-23) when debugging sessions start, capturing circadian effects on performance

constructs.name: topic_category
constructs.description: Topic cluster of each search, used to measure context switching via topic diversity

constructs.name: is_official_doc
constructs.description: Whether a URL visited during debugging is official documentation vs community forum

constructs.name: leisure_activity_count
constructs.description: Count of non-technical browsing activities indicating breaks and mental rest

constructs.name: debugging_sessions_today
constructs.description: Number of distinct debugging sessions on a given day, indicating debugging workload

constructs.name: learning_activity_count
constructs.description: Count of technical learning activities (not debugging), indicating knowledge building

constructs.name: initial_query_technical_terms
constructs.description: Count of technical/specific terms in the first search query of a debugging session

constructs.name: error_domain_familiarity
constructs.description: Latent familiarity and expertise with the specific error domain, shaped by exposure and learning

constructs.name: cognitive_efficiency
constructs.description: Latent cognitive state affecting information processing speed, focus, and problem-solving ability

constructs.name: search_strategy_quality
constructs.description: Latent quality of debugging search approach - knowing what to search, where to look, how to refine

constructs.name: is_weekend
constructs.description: Whether the day is a weekend (Saturday or Sunday)

constructs.name: activity_gap_hours
constructs.description: Hours since last browsing activity when debugging session starts, indicating fresh start vs continuous work

edges.description: More exposure to technical topics builds familiarity with error patterns and solutions
Technical learning expands knowledge base and deepens understanding of concepts
Greater familiarity enables faster pattern recognition of errors and known solutions
Domain expertise helps formulate better search queries and know where to find answers
High topic diversity (many distinct categories) depletes working memory and reduces efficiency
Circadian rhythms affect alertness and cognitive performance throughout the day
Mental breaks allow cognitive recovery, reduce fatigue, and improve subsequent focus
Accumulated debugging workload depletes mental resources and increases fatigue
Starting fresh after a break vs continuous work affects mental sharpness
Weekend debugging may have different cognitive context - either more relaxed or less focused
Higher cognitive efficiency enables faster information processing and problem solving
Better cognitive state leads to more thoughtful, strategic search behavior
Better search strategy leads to more efficient queries and fewer iterations needed
Good strategy manifests in more specific, targeted initial search queries
Skilled debuggers know to prioritize official documentation over forums
More specific initial queries find relevant results faster, reducing resolution time
More search iterations extend the debugging session duration
Official documentation typically provides more accurate, authoritative solutions faster
Domain knowledge enables more precise error query formulation from the start
